greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partial permutations of {1,2,...,n} that have exactly k cycles, 0<=k<=n.
comment: A partial permutation on a set X is a bijection between two subsets of X.
First column (corresponding to k=0) is A000262.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..50, flattened
Philippe Flajolet and Robert Sedgewick, Analytic Combinatorics, Cambridge Univ. Press, 2009, page 132.
formula: The row polynomials R(n,y), n > = 0, satisfy the 2nd order recurrence equation R(n,y) = (2*n + y - 1)*R(n-1,y) - (n - 1)*(n + y - 2)*R(n-2,y) with R(0,y) = 1 and R(1,y) = 1 + y.

Modulo variations in offset we have: R(n,0) = A000262, R(n,1) = A002720, R(n,2) = A000262, R(n,3) = A052852, R(n,4) = A062147, R(n,5) = A062266 and R(n,6) = A062192. In general, for fixed k, the sequence {R(n,k)}n>=1 gives the entries on a diagonal of the square array A088699. (End)
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Sep 04 2012
